headline: WAB Q3 Deep Dive: International Orders and Tariff Pressures Shape Outlook
summary: Rail equipment company Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies (NYSE:WAB) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 8.4% year on year to $2.89 billion. The company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $11.08 billion at the midpoint. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.32 per share was 2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Wabtec (WAB): Margin Expansion Reinforces Bullish Narrative Despite Valuation Concerns
summary: Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies (WAB) posted earnings growth of 13.6% over the past year, a solid result but trailing its five-year average of 22.4% per year. Shares closed at $193.43, trading at a premium to an estimated fair value of $175.46. Its Price-To-Earnings Ratio stands at 28.8x, which is above both its industry and peer averages. The company’s net profit margin rose to 10.9% from 9.9%, underscoring ongoing improvements in profitability despite a slower growth outlook. See our...
